Start.text:
This program will walk you through how to help an emergency medical situation.


 Have someone call 911 now and follow the directions to the best of your ability.

IsSceneSafe.text: Is the scene safe for everyone? Clear Cause?
buttons: Scene safe for you but not for the patient

MovePT.text: Move the patient to somewhere safe for both you and the patient
buttons: Patient cannot be moved to a safe location

TestNode.text: If device has gotten reading click yes and continue for informed decision

Call911.text: Ensure 911 has been called and wait in a safe place for EMS to arrive

PTAwake.text: Is the patient awake and able to speak well? Address the patient directly

SternumRub.text: Ensure 911 has been called and emergency services are coming. Rub the patient's sternum.
buttons: Patient has become able to speak well

AskWitnesses.text: Apply the pulse oximeter in the case on the patients finger as shown below. If injury is not apparent, ask witnesses if anyone knows what is wrong with the patient

Trauma.text: Has patient sustained any possible neck/head/spine injury?

InLineStabilization.text: Perform the in line stabilization move as shown below

buttons: The patient is breathing but vomiting

JawThrust.text: Perform the jaw thrust move as shown below

ApplyPO/AssessBreath.text: Apply the pulse oximeter in the case on the patients finger as shown below

EmergencyPos.text: Place the patient in the emergency position as shown below. Ensure their airway is kept clear
buttons: Patient moved into the emergency position

NeckPulse.text: Feel for pulse in the neck as shown below. If none, begin CPR. If available, apply an AED and follow the provided instructions. Otherwise, wait for EMS.

SupplementO2.text: Ensure that 911 has been called and wait for EMS to arrive. If possible, supply the patient with supplemental oxygen. If possible, have someone else find a person with medical experience

ApplyBP.text: Apply the blood pressure monitor on the upper arm of the patient. Use the velcro to make it moderately tight. Once on, press the blue Start/Stop button. Wait for monitor to take reading
buttons: Blood pressure cuff unable to be attached

KeepComfortable.text: Ensure 911 has been called and wait for EMS to arrive. In the mean time, keep the patient comfortable. If possible, have someone else find a person with medical experience
